title: Review Technician MOM change + update CLAUDE.md with validation results
description:
After BL-030 (completed) and BL-034 (validation complete), document Technician MOM 58→64 change:

1. Review archetypes.ts change (Technician MOM=64) from prior session
2. Verify test assertions across calculator.test.ts and match.test.ts
3. Update CLAUDE.md:
   - Archetype stats: Technician MOM=64
   - Live Data: Updated win rates from BL-034 sweep (52-53% bare, 45-47% uncommon, 48-50% epic, 48-51% giga)
   - Test Suite: Confirm 853 tests (8 added by QA Round 3 rare/epic melee tests)

DEPENDS ON: BL-030 (COMPLETE), BL-034 (COMPLETE), BL-065 (COMPLETE).

Acceptance criteria: CLAUDE.md reflects Technician MOM=64, current test count (853), rare/epic tier findings, variant impact notes.

title: New player experience — first-match clarity audit — COMPLETE
description:
✅ COMPLETED Round 2: Comprehensive walkthrough of first-time player experience identified 6 clarity gaps and 4 prioritized improvements. Full analysis written to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-3.md.

Clarity gaps: stat abbreviations (MOM/CTL/GRD/INIT/STA), gear overwhelm, speed/power tradeoff, counter system learn-by-losing, pass results unexplained, melee transition jarring.

Proposals ranked by impact:
- P1: Stat Tooltips (⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐) — unblocks 80% of confusion
- P2: Impact Breakdown (⭐⭐⭐⭐) — closes learning loop
- P3: Loadout Presets (implemented in BL-058)
- P4: Counter Chart (⭐⭐⭐)

title: ARIA attributes and semantic markup for accessibility — COMPLETE
description: ✅ COMPLETED Round 1: Extended accessibility to SpeedSelect.tsx and AttackSelect.tsx (attack cards + melee wins dots). All interactive elements now keyboard-navigable with proper aria-labels. 830+ tests (no breakage).

title: Rare/epic tier balance sweep (fill tier gap) — COMPLETE
description: ✅ COMPLETED Round 2: Rare and epic tier win rates documented with full analysis. Epic tier is MOST compressed (5.7pp spread, 0 flags). Charger epic peak confirmed (51%). Technician rare spike (55.1%) resolves by epic (49.2%). Bulwark dominance fade validated. All findings in orchestrator/analysis/balance-tuner-round-2.md. Verdict: No balance changes needed.

title: Gear variant affinity hints + quick build presets — COMPLETE
description: ✅ COMPLETED Round 2: Implemented all 3 proposals from BL-040: (1) Affinity labels in variant tooltips, (2) Quick Builds section (3 preset buttons reducing 27 gear choices to 1 click), (3) Matchup hint with heuristic-based win rate estimate + confidence level. All 830 tests passing. LoadoutScreen.tsx and App.css updated.

title: Melee carryover + softCap interaction tests — COMPLETE
description: ✅ COMPLETED Round 2: Added 15 comprehensive tests covering stamina carryover, counter+softCap, breaker penetration, carryover penalties, extreme cases, asymmetric scenarios. Tests 830→845 (+15). All passing. Zero bugs found. Stat pipeline confirmed (carryover → softCap → fatigue). Analysis in orchestrator/analysis/qa-round-2.md.

title: Stat bar animations + rarity glow stacking — COMPLETE
description: ✅ COMPLETED Round 2: Implemented 3 polish enhancements: (1) Stat bar smooth fill 0.4s ease-in-out, (2) Rarity glow stacking (Epic 1x, Legendary 2x, Relic 3x), (3) Disabled state styling (opacity 0.5 + cursor: not-allowed). All 830 tests passing. Production-ready CSS system.

title: Design stat tooltips for Setup Screen (onboarding critical)
description:
CRITICAL: BL-041 identified stat abbreviations (MOM/CTL/GRD/INIT/STA) as opaque jargon blocking ~80% of new player clarity. Design tooltip specs for Setup Screen.

**Specs**: For each stat, provide:
1. Full name (e.g., Momentum, Control, Guard, Initiative, Stamina)
2. Plain-English description (e.g., "Attack speed and power")
3. Icon or visual indicator (if applicable)
4. Interaction pattern (hover, focus, mobile tap)

**Examples**:
- MOM (Momentum) → "Attack speed and power — faster attacks hit harder"
- CTL (Control) → "Defense sharpness — sharper counters and parries"
- GRD (Guard) → "Armor strength — better damage mitigation"
- INIT (Initiative) → "Action order — higher INIT acts first in speed selection"
- STA (Stamina) → "Fatigue resistance — higher STA sustains effort longer"

**Note**: UI analysis (BL-062 readiness) reveals infrastructure 75% complete. Focus design on:
- Plain-English wording (avoid jargon)
- Mobile touch support (not just hover)
- Screen reader friendly (aria-describedby compatible)

**Acceptance criteria**: Tooltip design specs (text + mockup), responsive layout (desktop/tablet/mobile 320px), keyboard + screen reader accessible, integration notes for ui-dev.

Write to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4.md.

title: Implement stat tooltips UI on Setup Screen (onboarding critical)
description:
Follow-up to BL-061 design specs. Implement stat name + description tooltips on SetupScreen.

**Readiness**: BL-062 is 75% complete (infrastructure exists in src/ui/helpers.tsx STAT_TIPS + src/index.css tooltip system). Gaps: keyboard a11y, mobile touch support, screen reader compatibility.

**Acceptance criteria**:
1. Hover tooltips on each stat label (MOM/CTL/GRD/INIT/STA) showing full name + description
2. Keyboard accessible (Tab to stat, focus reveals tooltip)
3. Mobile: tap/long-press reveals tooltip (persistent until dismissed)
4. Responsive layout (tooltips fit within viewport on 320px mobile)
5. Tooltips styled to match design system (colors, fonts, spacing)
6. Screen reader friendly (aria-describedby, proper ARIA labels)
7. 853+ tests passing (no regressions)

**Implementation notes**:
- Update src/ui/SetupScreen.tsx with tooltip accessibility fixes
- Refactor CSS tooltips to React component for mobile support (or CSS-only with touch handlers)
- Add aria-describedby linking to hidden tooltip content
- Test responsive layout on 320px mobile viewport
- Verify keyboard Tab navigation works (focus trap management)

Estimate: 1-4 hours (depending on design complexity). Unblocks BL-063.

title: Design impact breakdown UI for pass results (learning loop critical)
description:
CRITICAL: BL-041 identified "pass results unexplained" as major clarity gap. Players can't learn why they won/lost each pass. Design expandable Impact Breakdown card for pass result screen.

**Proposal**: Show detailed breakdown of pass resolution:
1. **Your Impact**: X (with bar graph showing vs opponent)
2. **Opponent Impact**: Y
3. **Margin**: ±Z (who won by how much)
4. **Attack Advantage** (if any): e.g., "Coup en Passant beats Guard Low"
5. **Guard Contribution** (if applicable): e.g., "Your guard absorbed 15 impact"
6. **Fatigue Effect** (if applicable): e.g., "You were 20% fatigued (MOM -15)"

**Interaction**:
- Expandable card (collapsed by default on mobile, expanded on desktop)
- Clear labels + icons for each stat
- Bar graph showing relative impact (visual comparison)
- Responsive layout

**Acceptance criteria**: Detailed UI mockup, responsive design, accessibility notes, integration plan with PassResult component.

Write to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4.md.

title: Implement impact breakdown UI for pass results (learning loop critical)

2. Displays: Your Impact, Opponent Impact, Margin, Attack Advantage, Guard Contribution, Fatigue Effect
3. Bar graph comparing your impact vs opponent impact (visual comparison)
4. Icons + clear labels for each stat
5. Responsive layout (fits within viewport on 320px mobile)

8. 853+ tests passing (no regressions)

- Find PassResult component (may be inline in App.tsx or separate file)

Estimate: 6-12 hours (depends on engine refactoring). Medium risk due to dependencies.

Depends on BL-063 (design).

title: Rare/epic tier melee exhaustion tests (validation) — COMPLETE
description:
✅ COMPLETED Round 3: Added 8 comprehensive tests covering rare/epic tier stability:

**Tests Added**:
1. Rare tier multi-round stability (2 tests): Charger/Technician 3-round, Tactician/Breaker with penetration
2. Epic tier carryover + softCap (3 tests): Unseated charger with penalties, softCap boundary crossing, stamina drain validation
3. Mixed tier + variant stress (3 tests): Rare vs epic with variants, epic mirror match, carryover stacking validation

**Results**: Tests 845→853 (+8 tests, exceeds requirement). All passing. Zero bugs found. Rare/epic tier stability validated across carryover, softCap, variants, and multi-round combat.

Analysis written to orchestrator/analysis/qa-round-3.md.

title: Variant-specific win rate analysis (gear impact quantification) — COMPLETE
description:
✅ COMPLETED Round 3: Comprehensive variant analysis across 6 configurations (43,200 total matches, N=200 per matchup):

**Simulations**: Bare (aggressive/defensive), Uncommon (aggressive/balanced/defensive, full 6×6×3), Giga (aggressive/balanced/defensive, full 6×6×3)

**5 Critical Findings**:
1. Aggressive gear AMPLIFIES imbalance (Bulwark +6.2pp at giga, Charger +0.3pp — softCap compression kills MOM scaling)
2. Defensive gear COMPRESSES balance — 6.6pp spread at giga (BEST BALANCE EVER, zero flags)
3. Variant effect size > Rarity effect size (±2.6pp swing = 3+ rarity tiers of impact)
4. Balanced variant = Legacy baseline (MEMORY.md needs correction)
5. Matchup-level variant impact 10-15pp swings
6. Aggressive gear creates "snowball" melee-favored dynamics (+15.8pp melee rate)

**Verdict**: Variant system WORKING AS DESIGNED. No code changes needed. UI tooltips needed to explain aggressive≠better.

Analysis written to orchestrator/analysis/balance-tuner-round-3.md (485 lines).

title: Design counter system learning aid (teachable mechanics)
description:
Follow-up to BL-041. Counter system identified as "learn-by-losing" — players don't understand rock-paper-scissors until they experience losses. Design visual counter chart for AttackSelect screen.

**Proposal**: Visual chart showing all 6 attack relationships:
- High Guard: beats Low Cut, weak to Measured Cut
- Low Cut: beats Coup en Passant, weak to High Guard
- Measured Cut: beats High Guard, weak to Low Cut
- Port de Lance: beats Measured Cut, weak to High Guard  
- Coup en Passant: beats High Guard, weak to Low Cut
- (6th attack — verify in code)

**Format options**:
1. **Triangle diagram** (3 attacks arranged as triangle, each beats one side, weak to other)
2. **Matrix chart** (6×6 grid showing all matchups)
3. **Beats/Weak to text** with visual icons

**Acceptance criteria**: Chart design mockup, visual clarity on beats/weak-to relationships, mobile-responsive layout, accessibility notes (screen reader friendly), integration plan for AttackSelect.

Write to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4.md.

Estimate: 4-8 hours. Low risk (pure UI work, no engine dependencies).

Depends on BL-067 (design).

title: All 36 archetype matchups in melee (comprehensive coverage) — STRETCH
description:
STRETCH GOAL: BL-065 completed 8 rare/epic tests. Add comprehensive melee tests for all 36 archetype matchups (6×6) for total coverage.

**Proposal**: Add 36 deterministic melee tests (6 archetypes × 6 archetypes):
- Each test simulates 2-3 rounds of melee
- Both archetypes at uncommon rarity (representative)
- All deterministic (set RNG seed for reproducibility)
- Verify no infinite loop edge cases
- Verify stat carryover + softCap work correctly

**Acceptance criteria**:
1. All 36 matchups tested (comprehensive coverage)
2. Tests deterministic and reproducible
3. No infinite loop edge cases
4. 889+ total tests (853 current + 36 new melee tests)
5. All passing, no regressions

**Note**: ONLY if capacity after BL-062/064 critical work complete. Can run in parallel with ui-dev work.

Write tests to src/engine/gear-variants.test.ts.

Write to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4.md.

title: NEW: Design variant tooltips (aggressive/balanced/defensive strategy explanations)
description:
Follow-up to BL-066 (balance-tuner variant analysis). BL-066 discovered variant system creates MASSIVE balance swings (±7pp for Bulwark, ±3pp for Charger) but players don't understand aggressive≠better.

**Problem**: Players assume "Aggressive = Better" and miss strategic depth. Without tooltips, players may optimize for wrong variant (e.g., aggressive Charger at giga is WORSE than defensive +2.9pp).

**Solution**: Add variant tooltips on gear selection screen explaining strategic impact:
- **Aggressive**: "Higher offense, lower defense. Favors quick unseats and melee. Riskier stamina. ±6pp swing at giga."
- **Balanced**: "Equal offense and defense. Reliable for all playstyles. Legacy baseline."
- **Defensive**: "Higher defense, lower offense. Favors long jousts and stamina endurance. Safer against unseats. ±1-3pp swing at giga."

**Key insights for tooltips**:
- Variant choice = 3+ rarity tiers of impact (NOT cosmetic)
- Aggressive creates "snowball" melee-favored dynamics (+15.8pp more melee matches)
- Defensive produces BEST GIGA BALANCE EVER (6.6pp spread, zero flags)
- Charger better with defensive (+2.9pp), NOT aggressive (+0.3pp)

**Acceptance criteria**: Variant strategy tooltips (text for all 3 variants), placement on LoadoutScreen, mockup showing tooltip positioning, acceptance criteria for ui-dev implementation.

Write to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4.md.

title: Update MEMORY.md with variant-aware win rate notes (critical for next session)
description:
Follow-up to BL-066 (balance-tuner variant analysis). BL-066 Finding 4 revealed MEMORY.md win rates are misleading:

**Current problem**: MEMORY.md lists win rates (39.0% Charger, 61.4% Bulwark) without noting these assume **balanced variant**. Aggressive/defensive create ±3-5pp swings (Bulwark ±7.5pp at giga).

**Fix needed**: Add to MEMORY.md "Current Archetype Stats & Win Rates" section:
```
**IMPORTANT**: Win rates shown for balanced variant (legacy default).
- Aggressive variant: ±3-5pp swings (Bulwark +6pp, Charger +0pp at giga)
- Defensive variant: ±3-5pp swings (Bulwark -1pp, Charger +3pp at giga)
- Variant choice affects matchups by 2-15pp (e.g., Charger vs Bulwark 37%→50% aggressive→balanced at giga)
- Defensive giga produces BEST BALANCE EVER (6.6pp spread, zero flags)
```

**Acceptance criteria**: MEMORY.md updated with variant impact notes, cross-references to BL-066 analysis, clarity for future agents on balanced=baseline assumption.

Files: MEMORY.md
